column4: hmm....so hey can somebody point me to some basic reading for compiling my own kernel?
En googlis :-)
Your resolv.conf is jacked up?
well.....firefox seems to resolve the URLS fine...
That makes no sense
What is in /etc/resolv.conf ?
I don't think that is right.  Is firefox using your adsl router as a proxy?
nope..it is working w/o proxies
u think i should directly add the DNS server to the resolv.conf and try?
Yes, I would try that
Congrats
Force rem the linux directory and any subdirectories under it
ok..but wht does it contain? the linux directory...
What directory are you in?
this is wht i am referring to http://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/reference/ch-kernel.en.html
there are two methods mentioned on the site http://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/reference/ch-kernel.en.html, which one should i use bddebian?
Oh, that is just deleting the linux source directory from /usr/src
I would pull the ubuntu source package if you can
Then you are fine
it says here to make a symbolic link from linnux-2.6.whtever to linux.......wht if i just rename?
That works but a symbolic link is better if you want to keep a couple of kernel trees around
